briefdescription.para: In: Array previously returned by bio_readhdr
In: Array previously returned by bio_readhdr
Free name and value strings previously allocated and returned by bio_readhdr.
Write a simple binary file header, containing only the version string.

detaileddescription.para:
Also write the byte order magic word.
0 if successful, -1 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Write a simple binary file header with only byte order magic word.
Out: array of argument name strings read
Read binary file format header: has the following format.

detaileddescription.para:
s3 <argument-name> <argument-value> <argument-name> <argument-value> ... endhdr 4-byte byte-order word used to find file byte ordering relative to host machine. Lines beginning with # are ignored. Memory for name and val allocated by this function; use bio_hdrarg_free to free them.
0 if successful, -1 otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (const void *buf, int32 el_sz, int32 n_el, uint32 sum)
memberdef.name: chksum_accum

memberdef.argsstring: (void *buf, int32 el_sz, int32 n_el, FILE *fp, int32 swap, uint32 *chksum)
memberdef.name: bio_fread

briefdescription.para: Like fread but perform byteswapping and accumulate checksum (the 2 extra arguments).

simplesect.para: unlike fread, returns -1 if required number of elements (n_el) not read; also, no byteswapping or checksum accumulation is performed in that case.

memberdef.argsstring: (const void *buf, int32 el_sz, int32 n_el, FILE *fp, int32 swap, uint32 *chksum)
memberdef.name: bio_fwrite

briefdescription.para: Like fwrite but perform byteswapping and accumulate checksum (the 2 extra arguments).

simplesect.para: the number of elemens written (like fwrite).

memberdef.argsstring: (void **buf, size_t el_sz, uint32 *n_el, FILE *fp, int32 sw, uint32 *ck)
memberdef.name: bio_fread_1d

briefdescription.para: Out: contains array data; allocated by this function; can be freed using ckd_free
Out: Number of array elements allocated/read

listitem.para: memory allocated for the array and read (returned in buf)

detaileddescription.para:
Byteswapping and checksum accumulation performed as necessary. Fails fatally if expected data not read.
number of array elements allocated and read; -1 if error.

memberdef.argsstring: (void ***arr, size_t e_sz, uint32 *d1, uint32 *d2, FILE *fp, uint32 swap, uint32 *chksum)

memory allocated for the array and read (returned in buf)

detaileddescription.para:
Byteswapping and checksum accumulation performed as necessary. Fails fatally if expected data not read.
number of array elements allocated and read; -1 if error.

listitem.para: 4-byte # matrices, # rows, # columns (returned in d1, d2, d3)
memory allocated for the array and read (returned in buf)

detaileddescription.para:
Byteswapping and checksum accumulation performed as necessary. Fails fatally if expected data not read.
number of array elements allocated and read; -1 if error.

briefdescription.para: In: Value to compare with checksum in file
Read and verify checksum at the end of binary file.

detaileddescription.para: Fails fatally if there is a mismatch.

memberdef.argsstring: (void ***arr, size_t e_sz, uint32 d1, uint32 d2, uint32 d3, FILE *fp, uint32 *chksum)
memberdef.name: bio_fwrite_3d

briefdescription.para: In: Size of the elements in bytes

simplesect.para: number of array elements successfully written or -1 if error.

In: the name of the file
In: the size of the header to skip usually 44 bytes
